newsitem.title: USA: United Airlines adds cargo fuel surcharge.
newsitem.headline: United Airlines adds cargo fuel surcharge.

text.p: United Airlines will begin applying a $0.10/kilogram surcharge to all cargo shipments between the US and Europe and from the U.S. to Latin America, said cargo marketing manager Nancy Russler.
There is no surcharge northbound from Latin America to the U.S..

Russler said the surcharge, which takes effect Nov 15, will partly offset sharply higher jet fuel prices and mirrors action being taken by many other carriers in competitive corridors. -Air Cargo Newsroom Tel +44 171 542 7706 Fax +44 171 542 5017
